field_edited_text.value:
12 ENGINEERING PROCEDURE

c. Periodic painting of all structural steel work and
buildings.
d. Maintenance of substructures.

K. Estimate of annual operation expenses to include the follow-
ing items of operation:—

a. Supervision and general overhead.
b. Toll taking personnel.

c. Auditing personnel.

d. Fiscal personnel and expenses.

L. Statement of prospective revenues taken directly from traffic
report, prepared by Coverdale and Colpitts.

M. A complete schedule of successive operations for each cross-
ing, subdivided into the various contracts and various
classes of construction, and extending through the entire
period from the actual start of preliminary work to the final
completion date. This schedule was made up in form of a
progress chart, the vertical spaces on the chart to represent
calendar months and the horizontal lines divided into groups
to cover each step of engineering, each step in the preparation
of contract plans and specifications for various contracts,
period during which plans and specifications are out for bids,
due allowance for time required for execution of contract,
actual date of beginning work on each contract, and com-
pletion date of each contract.

Mr. Ole Singstad, Consulting Engineer of New York, was called in by
J. E. Greiner Company to collaborate with them on the development of
preliminary plans and estimates for a tunnel across the Patapsco River
between Canton and Fairfield. The tunnel plans and estimates included
in this report are the results of the work done by Mr. Ole Singstad both in
the Greiner office in Baltimore and in his New York office.

Dr. Glennon Gilboy, Lincoln, Massachusetts, Professor of soil analysis
at Massachusetts Institute of Technology, was called in by J. E. Greiner
Company for consultations in connection with the soil characteristics of
the various strata through which borings were taken at the sites of the
crossings. A statement was prepared covering the work which Dr. Glen-
non Gilboy did in connection with the boring samples which were made
available for his examination and study. This statement is on file in the
Greiner Office.
